wall_clock

This component is used to set and retrieve the current system date and time. The date-time format is the w3c standard where the complete date is displayed with the hours, minutes and seconds in the format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss where YYYY is a 4-digit year, MM is a 2-digit month, DD is a 2-digit day of the month, hh is 2 digits of the hour, mm is 2 digits of the minute and ss is 2 digits of the second. For example 1997-07-16T19:20:30 is a valid date-time string.

When the input event [In]get fires, the current date and time is presented to the data output [Out]Date String in the w3c format described above and the corresponding output event is triggered. Also the number of minutes elapsed since 1970-01-01T00:00:00 is presented to the data output [Out]Mins 1970 and the residual number of seconds presented to the data output [Out]& secs.

When the input event [In]set fires, the sytem date and time is set to the date-time string, in the w3c format described above, presented to the data input [Out]time.

Ports

  • [In] get:

    Input event, gets the current system time.

  • [Out] Date String:

    Data output, the system date and time in the w3c format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

  • [Out] ------:

    Output event, triggered when the corresponding input event fires.

  • [In] set:

    Input event, sets the current system time.

  • [In] time:

    Data input, the date and time to set the system to, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

  • [Out] -----:

    Output event, triggered when the corresponding input event fires.

  • [Out] Mins 1970:

    Data output, the number of minutes elapsed since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.

  • [Out] & secs:

    Data output, the residual number of seconds after the minutes elapsed since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.

Parameters

None.

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.
